concept.title: Map Visualizer
concept.shortdesc: View your DITA map structure as an interactive tree diagram.

section.title: Overview
section.p: The Map Visualizer provides a graphical representation of your DITA map hierarchy. It displays the relationship between maps, chapters, and topics in an easy-to-navigate tree view.

ol.li: The visualizer opens in a side panel

section.title: Tree Structure
section.p: The visualizer displays your map hierarchy with different node types:

dlentry.dd: The root of the tree, representing the ditamap or bookmap file.
Major divisions in bookmaps, shown as expandable folders.
Individual topic files referenced by the map.
Submaps referenced via <mapref> appear as expandable subtrees.

ul.li: Click: Select a node and open the corresponding file in the editor
Double-click: Open the file and close the visualizer panel
Expand/Collapse: Click the arrow icons to show or hide child nodes
Right-click: Access context menu with additional options

section.title: Visual Indicators
section.p: The visualizer uses icons and colors to convey information:

ul.li: File Icons: Different icons for maps, topics, and other file types
Validation Status: Red indicators show files with errors
Missing Files: Broken references are highlighted
Current File: The currently edited file is highlighted
You add or remove topicref elements from the map
You create or delete topic files
Validation status changes for any file
Content Audit: Review your document structure at a glance
Navigation: Quickly jump to any topic in a large documentation set
Validation Review: Identify which files have errors
Structure Planning: Visualize how content is organized
